Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement to sit where it wants to - "waiting my turn" -, and the Dutch continue to challenge this deeply ingrained U.S. cultural sense by insisting on demanding respect and asserting their right through diplomatic means to boorish rudeness.

The only reason I am commenting is because I finally figured out why Dr. Cox was bald. Although we probably all realized it at the same time this week Dr. Cox is bald because he has Raynaud's syndrome. If you look carefully every time he is disgusted, annoyed, or stressed you can see his finger tips go white. His wife had gastric bypass and they argue about her weight all the time. Essentially, Dr. Cox is the male J. D.

predictable, campy, bad special effects. it has a TV-movie feeling to it. the voices work nicely--there is a Brick and Mortar on tour of Europe. foreshadowing plus the vampires. The kid knitting the sweater...that was pretty hilarious.

at first I was all, hmmm, Baudelaire acronynm from Charles Baudelaire?

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with spikes with feeding tubes going all over the place and several skeletons and bodies half eaten. So what are they living with and more importantly who or what is after them? Worth watching, good plot and character build.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie in a theater..

However, I was too tired to watch John Carter and fell asleep with approximately 20 minutes left to go.

I fell asleep in the theater because it has been a long day.. kind of hard to blame it on the movie.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to the original graphic novel by Matt Wagner - and there's a huge difference to the reality and what we have seen on screen. Unfortunately. The good points are a praiseworthy start, with a mysterious environment and with the foundry (the Grin. Unbelievably dark).

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures in the countless empires that make up the new Milky Way Galaxy OverSpan Space Toledo: Alien Astronaut Station 'The League of Galactic Space Harmattan Expedition. Toledo Space travels OverSpan Space is about Escapist fiction.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly a throwback to the 80's, has some decent fight scenes, and is ultimately enjoyable to watch if you're not looking for anything too deep.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>
